categories.name: The Art of Pizza: From Dough to Delivery

questions.clue: For 200 points: This Italian city is widely credited as the birthplace of pizza.
For 400 points: A pizza term, it also refers to a Magic: The Gathering card type that can cast spells.
For 600 points: This essential ingredient is responsible for the rise of pizza dough.
For 800 points: Known for its thick crust, this American city's style of pizza is often baked in a deep pan.
For 1000 points: This pizza variant shares its name with a Magic: The Gathering color associated with nature and growth.
This colorless artifact from the Legends set is known for its ability to grant any color of mana.
This legendary creature from the Legends set shares its name with a topping found on pizzas and has the power to regenerate.
In the lore of Magic: The Gathering, this ancient dragon is known as the eldest and most powerful of the Elder Dragons.
This legendary planeswalker originally appeared in the Legends set and is known for her ability to control time.
This character, introduced in the Legends set, is a vampire and the ancestor to a prominent family in Innistrad.
This Italian city, famous for its ancient ruins and mouthwatering pizza, has been the capital since 1871.
Known for its rich history, this city was the capital of Japan before Tokyo took over in 1869.
This South American city, the highest capital in the world, is where you can find magical views of the Andes.
Before Washington D.C., this city served as the temporary capital of the United States from 1790 to 1800.
This capital city was known as Byzantium and later Constantinople before taking its current name in 1930.
This Italian dish, often topped with cheese and tomato sauce, was revolutionized by the invention of the modern pizza oven in the 19th century.
Gutenberg's invention around 1440, which enabled mass production of books, is considered one of the most important in history.
This trading card game, first released in 1993, was the first of its kind and inspired countless others.
Developed in the 1940s, this technology uses vacuum tubes or transistors to perform calculations and has evolved into the essential device we use today.
In 1969, this U.S. Department of Defense project initiated what would become the global network we know today.
In this novel, the first line reads: 'Call me Ishmael.'
This novel begins with: 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.'
This fantasy classic opens with: 'In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit.'
The first line of this novel is: 'It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.'
This dystopian novel begins with: 'It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.'

final.clue: In Magic: The Gathering, this flavorful term, also a popular pizza ingredient, describes a card's ability to create unexpected synergies with other cards.
